intro: Nothotalisia cancellata, commonly known as the white-veined hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with white petals and prominent yellow stamens. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a distinctive veining pattern. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its natural distribution in tropical regions.
